philjs-ssr

View source

Server-side rendering utilities for PhilJS applications.

Functions

Synchronously renders a component tree to an HTML string.

function renderToString(fn: () => JSX.Element, options?: RenderOptions): string

Parameters

fn() => JSX.ElementFunction that returns the component to render
options?RenderOptionsRendering options

Returns

stringHTML string of the rendered component

Example

1import { renderToString } from 'philjs-ssr';
2import { App } from './App';
3 
4const html = renderToString(() => <App />);
5 
6console.log(html); // '<div>...</div>'

Renders a component tree to a readable stream for progressive rendering.

function renderToStream(fn: () => JSX.Element, options?: RenderOptions): ReadableStream

Parameters

fn() => JSX.ElementFunction that returns the component to render
options?RenderOptionsRendering options

Returns

ReadableStreamStream of HTML chunks

Example

1import { renderToStream } from 'philjs-ssr';
2import { App } from './App';
3 
4app.get('*', (req, res) => {
5  const stream = renderToStream(() => <App url={req.url} />);
6 
7  res.setHeader('Content-Type', 'text/html');
8  stream.pipeTo(res);
9});

Hydrates a server-rendered component tree, making it interactive.

function hydrate(fn: () => JSX.Element, node: Element): () => void

Parameters

fn() => JSX.ElementFunction that returns the component to hydrate
nodeElementDOM node containing server-rendered HTML

Returns

() => voidDisposal function

Example

1import { hydrate } from 'philjs-ssr';
2import { App } from './App';
3 
4hydrate(
5  () => <App />,
6  document.getElementById('app')!
7);

Wraps async components and shows fallback content while loading.

function Suspense(props: SuspenseProps): JSX.Element

Parameters

props.fallbackJSX.ElementContent to show while children are suspending
props.childrenJSX.ElementComponents that may suspend

Example

1<Suspense fallback={<Spinner />}>
2  <AsyncUserProfile userId={userId()} />
3</Suspense>
4 
5// With multiple boundaries
6<Suspense fallback={<PageSkeleton />}>
7  <Header />
8  <Suspense fallback={<ContentSkeleton />}>
9    <MainContent />
10  </Suspense>
11  <Footer />
12</Suspense>

Sets the document title. Works with SSR.

function Title(props: { children: string }): JSX.Element

Parameters

props.childrenstringThe page title

Example

1function BlogPost(props: { post: Post }) {
2  return (
3    <>
4      <Title>{props.post.title} - My Blog</Title>
5      <article>{/* content */}</article>
6    </>
7  );
8}

Adds meta tags to the document head. Works with SSR.

function Meta(props: MetaProps): JSX.Element

Parameters

propsMetaPropsMeta tag attributes

Example

1<Meta name="description" content="Learn PhilJS" />
2<Meta property="og:title" content="PhilJS Tutorial" />
3<Meta property="og:image" content="/og-image.png" />
4<Meta name="twitter:card" content="summary_large_image" />

Adds link tags to the document head. Works with SSR.

function Link(props: LinkProps): JSX.Element

Parameters

propsLinkPropsLink tag attributes

Example

1<Link rel="canonical" href="https://example.com/page" />
2<Link rel="stylesheet" href="/styles.css" />
3<Link rel="icon" type="image/png" href="/favicon.png" />

Boolean indicating if code is running on the server.

const isServer: boolean

Example

1import { isServer } from 'philjs-ssr';
2 
3function Component() {
4  const data = createResource(async () => {
5    if (isServer) {
6      // Server-only code
7      return await db.query('...');
8    } else {
9      // Client-side fetch
10      return fetch('/api/data').then(r => r.json());
11    }
12  });
13 
14  return <div>{/* render data */}</div>;
15}

Template literal tag for SSR-safe HTML.

function ssr(template: string, ...values: any[]): { t: string }

Parameters

templatestringHTML template string
valuesany[]Values to interpolate

Returns

{ t: string }SSR-safe HTML object

Example

1function RawHTML() {
2  const content = ssr`
3    <div class="prose">
4      <h1>Title</h1>
5      <p>Content with <strong>HTML</strong></p>
6    </div>
7  `;
8 
9  return <div innerHTML={content.t} />;
10}

Creates an async resource that works with Suspense.

function createAsync<T>(fn: () => Promise<T>): Accessor<T | undefined>

Parameters

fn() => Promise<T>Async function to execute

Returns

Accessor<T | undefined>Accessor for the async result

Example

1function UserProfile(props: { userId: string }) {
2  const user = createAsync(async () => {
3    const res = await fetch(`/api/users/${props.userId}`);
4    return res.json();
5  });
6 
7  return (
8    <Suspense fallback={<Spinner />}>
9      <div>{user()?.name}</div>
10    </Suspense>
11  );
12}

Types

Options for server rendering functions.

Properties

PropertyTypeDescription
nonce?stringNonce for CSP
renderId?stringUnique ID for this render

Props for Meta component.

Properties

PropertyTypeDescription
name?stringMeta name attribute
property?stringMeta property attribute (for Open Graph)
contentstringMeta content
charset?stringCharacter encoding

Context provided by Suspense boundaries.

Properties

PropertyTypeDescription
suspendedbooleanWhether content is currently suspended
resourcesSet<Promise<any>>Pending resource promises
